item.title: All Active Honkai: Star Rail Redeem Codes (April 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Honkai: Star Rail Redeem Codes (April 2025)
  • How To Redeem Honkai: Star Rail Codes
  • Stellar Jade In Honkai: Star Rail

Honkai: Star Rail is developed by HoYoverse, the maker of Genshin Impact . This gacha game is a turn-based strategy RPG that's set in the Honkai universe, although it’s not a sequel to Honkai Impact 3rd .

Similar to Genshin Impact which often has some codes, Honkai: Star Rail also features some redeem codes for people to claim on launch day. This article will feature HSR redeem codes , how to redeem them, and other items players will get to begin their Trailblazing journey.

Honkai: Star Rail Redeem Codes (April 2025)

The following are all the HSR redeem codes for April 2025:

  • HSRCASTORICE (3 Traveler's Guide + 2 Redsoil Feed)
  • LS342LYLC5FP (50 Stellar Jades + 10k Credit)
  • FIGHTWELLMYDEI (3 Traveler's Guide + 2 Golden Honeycake)
  • WHEREISTRIBBIE (3 Traveler's Guide + 2 Oronyx Slate)
  • IFYOUAREREADINGTHIS (60 Stellar Jades + 1 Fuel)
  • STARRAILGIFT (50 Stellar Jades)

How To Redeem Honkai: Star Rail Codes

To redeem the HSR codes, log in to the Honkai: Star Rail redeem code website https://hsr.hoyoverse.com/gift, then manually input the codes, or simply press on the link to open the redemption site with the code automatically attached to it .

Players should ensure they have already made an account before trying to redeem. Otherwise, the website won't find the desired profile.

Alternatively, once players unlock the in-game menu, there will be a Redemption Code button under Trailblazer Profile , which can be accessed by pressing the menu button next to their MC's name.

Stellar Jade In Honkai: Star Rail

Stellar Jade is the primary currency for Honkai: Star Rail players. In Genshin Impact , it’s equivalent to Primogems, which means people will use it for gacha (called Warp in HSR) and to recover 60 Trailblaze Power, up to eight times per day. Just like in Genshin Impact , each Warp will cost 160 Stellar Jades, and there are two types of Warping currencies; Star Rail Pass and Star Rail Special Pass . The former is used for Standard Warp, while the latter is for Limited Banner, which includes Honkai: Star Rail Seele.

The game features a Beginner Banner for new players, which allows people to gain 50 Warp at the cost of 40. A guaranteed 5-star will also be rewarded after all 40 pulls are performed.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail – How To Get Golden & Silver Companion Spirit And Light Cone Memory Shard
item.description:
Every character in Honkai: Star Rail can have a maximum of six Eidolons. After that, any extra Eidolons will be wasted, and players will only get 100 Undying Starlights, or equivalent to five extra pulls. After version 3.2, however, getting an "E7" is not as frustrating as it will be converted into an item that can eventually be exchanged for a 5-star unit of the player's choice. This item is called Silver Companion Spirit, and it's just one of the three currencies released in HSR 3.2 to improve the player's enjoyment of gaining characters and weapons.

Here's all you need to know about Golden Companion Spirit, Silver Companion Spirit, and Light Cone Memory Shard in HSR .

Golden & Silver Companion Spirit In HSR - Honkai: Star Rail

There are two versions of Companion Spirit in Honkai: Star Rail , Golden Companion Spirit , and Silver Companion Spirit . Two Silver Companion Spirits will be converted into one Golden Companion Spirit, allowing players to continuously obtain the item even without any event.

To get Silver Companion Spirit, players must obtain an Eidolon on a 5-star character with a max Eidolon . This means getting an "E7" of a 5-star character will reward players with one Silver Companion Spirit, and experiencing this twice allows Trailblazer to get another 5-star character from the store.

Players who obtained "E7" of a character prior to version 3.2 will still get a Silver Companion Spirit for their old pulls.

Other than from the two Silver Companion Spirits, players can also get a Golden Companion Spirit from events . For example, in version 3.2, all Trailblazers can claim one Golden Companion Spirit for free. Additionally, Spenders can get another Golden Companion Spirit from the Cherished Recollection event by purchasing a total of 18,000 Oneiric Shards .

To exchange the Golden Companion Spirit in Honkai: Star Rail , head to Store > Stellar Convergence > Character Redemption . As of version 3.2, the available characters are:

  • Ruan Mei
  • Luocha
  • Himeko
  • Clara
  • Bronya
  • Welt
  • Gepard
  • Yanqing
  • Bailu

There's no expiration date for the character, meaning players can exchange anytime they want . Additionally, more units will be added in the future, so saving the Golden Companion Spirit is not a bad idea.

Light Cone Memory Shard In HSR - Honkai: Star Rail

There are two ways to get Light Cone Memory Shard in Honkai: Star Rail : From events or the Battle Pass. First, in version 3.2, spenders can get four Light Cone Memory Shards from the Cherished Recollection event by purchasing a total of 8,000 Oneiric Shards .

Unfortunately, the Memory Shard from the Battle Pass also involves spending. Players who buy the Battle Pass can get one Light Cone Memory Shard upon reaching level 10 . Those who upgrade their Battle Pass to the Nameless Medal version will get one extra Light Cone Memory Shard.

To exchange the Light Cone Memory Shard in Honkai: Star Rail , head to Store > Stellar Convergence > Light Cone Redemption ​​​​​​. Like the Character Redemption, there's no time limit for the trade, so players can take their time in deciding which item they want.

item.title: Every Major Video Game Release Coming Soon For Nintendo Switch
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Nintendo Switch Games Coming Out In April 2025
  • Nintendo Switch Games Coming Out In May 2025
  • Nintendo Switch Games Coming Out In June 2025
  • Major 2025 Nintendo Switch Games With No Release Dates Or Post-June 2025 Dates
  • Major Upcoming Nintendo Switch Games With No Release Year

The Nintendo Switch has been a runaway success, proving that raw power is not the be-all and end-all for consoles. Through a combination of Nintendo's first-party games, a solid selection of triple-A third-party titles, and all the indie projects anyone could ever want, the Switch has amassed a stellar library that can match most platforms in terms of quality and quantity.

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Super Mario Odyssey are two of the greatest games of the last decade, and they debuted within the Switch's debut year. There is also always a chance that the best Switch game has yet to be released. In just 2023, The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom , Metroid Prime Remastered , Pikmin 4 , Super Mario Wonder , and Advance Wars 1 + 2: Re-Boot Camp were all console exclusives. 2024 had quite a few exclusives as well, including games centering around Princess Peach and Zelda. Mario even received two RPGs.

Even though the Nintendo Switch 2 is on the horizon, its predecessor is not disappearing just yet. Here's a look at all the major titles we can expect to see on the Nintendo Switch in 2025 and beyond. Which big Nintendo Switch games have release dates ? Please note the focus is on North American release dates.

Only games for the original Nintendo Switch are included.

Updated April 9, 2025 by Mark Sammut: The upcoming Nintendo Switch games were added to the scheduler over the last two weeks: Windborn - Concrete Jungle, Machigai Sagashi Tantei, Pyramid Warp, Spot It Fast! Kids' Difference Hunt, Mayhem Mail, GunSpectre, Barista Simulator 2025, ReMix, Mortisomem, Gladiators Simulator: The Champions of Liberty, Shape Drop, Barista Coffee Simulator, Monument Valley, Moving Houses, StarLightRiders: HyperJump, Sacre Bleu, Snow Squall Grip, LunarLux, Maths Pals, I Am Busy Digging a Hole, Necroking, Thought Experiment Simulator, Vinebound: Tangled Together, Bubble Wizard II Saga, Skies Above, Chessarama, I, Robot, Cave of Illusions, High on Life, The Abandoned Planet, Dunk Dunk, Bernard, Into the Restless Ruins, Monster Train 2, Cosmi: Forbidden Forests, Tamagotchi Plaza, The Wandering Village, No Sleep for Kaname Date - From AI: The Somnium Files, Windborn - Wings of Fate, Operation Night Strikers, Iwakura Aria, Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar, 2weistein in Elfland.

Nintendo Switch Games Coming Out In April 2025

Utawarerumono & More

April 2025's Switch lineup has taken shape, although it is not exactly stuffed with major releases. Mandragora is another 2D side-scrolling Soulslike that looks very good, and Lunar Remastered Collection should be a fun JRPG option. Poppy's Playtime should also make the jump to the Nintendo Switch. Croc: Legend of the Gobbos also debuted on modern consoles, providing an updated version of the cult classic 3D platformer with modern controls.

Early in the month, Nintendo held a direct dedicated to the Nintendo Switch 2, revealing plans for the console to launch in June 2025. At this point, that system's launch is hogging most of the limelight, and it can be easy to forget that there are still plenty of 2025 Switch games left to drop.

  • April 1 : Nif Nif (PC, Switch)
  • April 1 : Space Battle (Switch)

  • April 25 : Two Strikes (PC, PS5, Switch, XBX/S)
  • April 29 : Creepy Tales Double Pack (PS5, Switch)
  • April 29 : My Vet Practice in the Zoo (PS5, Switch)
  • April 29 : Ogu and the Secret Forest (Switch)
  • April 30 : MotoGP 25 (PC, PS5, PS4, Switch, XBX/S, XBO)

Nintendo Switch Games Coming Out In May 2025

Fantasy Life i, Onimusha, & More

Compared to April, May 2025 looks set to be a decent month for the Nintendo Switch. Console owners have more than a few games to look forward to, including Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time by Level-5. The Japanese developer has a pretty great track record, and there is nothing to suggest this RPG will fail to live up to those high standards.

Onimusha 2 is receiving a remaster, just a few years after its predecessor received a very good update. Remasters and rereleases are a big part of May 2025 in general, as Capcom Fighting Collection 2 , Mobile Suit Gundam Seed Battle Destiny Remastered , and Ys Memoire: Memories of Celceta are set to launch within the month.

  • May 1 : 2weistein in Rongerland (Switch)
  • May 1 : Despelote (PC, PS5, PS4, Switch, XBX/S, XBO)
  • May 1 : Slide Defenders (Switch)

Nintendo Switch Games Coming Out In June 2025

Tron, System Shock, & More

At the moment, June does not seem set to be a particularly strong moment for Nintendo Switch games , which makes sense since all eyes will be on the launch of the Nintendo Switch 2. Still, that system's predecessor will be receiving new games. The biggest title announced is Tron: Catalyst , an action-adventure project set within Disney's franchise. That said, System Shock 2 remastered has also been announced, which is a major deal since the immersive sim is considered an all-time great game.

  • June 4 : Narcissus (Switch)
  • June 5 : Architect Life: A House Design Simulator (PC, PS5, Switch, XBX/S)
  • June 5 : Illvelo Swamp Happy Together (Switch)
  • June 5 : The Red Bell's Lament (Switch)
  • June 5 : Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma (PC, Switch)

  • June 27 : Tamagotchi Plaza (Switch)

Major 2025 Nintendo Switch Games With No Release Dates Or Post-June 2025 Dates

Metroid Prime, Little Nightmares, & More

2025 has a long way to go before reaching its final form, and only a handful of months have any titles at all. However, quite a few Nintendo Switch games have announced plans to debut within the year, even if they have opted to hold back on specific dates. Assuming it comes out, Metroid Prime 4: Beyond could very well be the console's biggest game of 2025, and "the console" qualifier might be unnecessary. Little Nightmares 3 will introduce co-op to the platform-horror series. The Legend of Heroes: Trails in the Sky the 1st and Mouse: PI For Hire all look great.

Major Upcoming Nintendo Switch Games With No Release Year

Pokemon Legends & More

The Nintendo Switch's lifespan is likely to come to an end over the next few years, but there are still quite a few announced games that are targeting releases for the console. ​​Titles like Pokemon Legends: Z-A and Hollow Knight: Silksong will be major deals whenever they launch, but it is hard to say if that will come to pass in 2025 or later.

item.title: How to Build a Deck in The Sims 4
item.description:
Players can show off their design skills by building in The Sims 4 . Because Build Mode is versatile, creating houses, venues, and community lots is one of the best parts of the life simulation for builders.

Players can create their own designs or take inspiration from real-life architecture. Adding a deck is a great way to give a building dimension and more space for Sims to enjoy. Here's a complete guide showing how to build decks and porches in The Sims 4 .

How to Build a Deck in The Sims 4

Whenever simmers start a new household, they can build a house from scratch or renovate one of the pre-made houses. Build/Buy mode can be accessed by clicking on the tools icon at the top right side of the screen. From here, players can build walls and floors and buy furniture to fill out their lots.

Build is where players find walls, floors, roofs, and decks. Decks are under the Walls and Empty Rooms category. There are several types of decks in The Sims 4 , including:

  • Triangular Deck
  • Square Deck
  • L-Shaped Deck
  • Octagonal Deck
  • Rounded Deck (Large, X-Large)
  • Square Deck (Diagonal)

Players can place them directly on the ground or on top of a foundation. To add a foundation, click on a room and drag the upward arrow. This will push the entire lot upwards.

Sims need stairs to get into places built on foundations.

If placed against a wall, decks will slot against a house. They can also be placed on the front of the home if players want it to act as a front porch. Decks can then be customized with foundations, fences, and pillars.

Decks can also be built over bodies of water, including ponds, and those with the Island Living Expansion Pack can build decks over the ocean if they have beachfront properties. Players can watch the video below to see various ways to build a deck in The Sims 4 :

How to Build a Wrap-Around Porch

Wrap-around porches are perfect additions to farmhouses and other larger structures. Players can make them modern or classic-looking.

  • Place a deck across the front of a house.
  • Pull the deck so it goes further than the wall.
  • Use the arrow to extend the deck around the building.
  • Add pillars across the deck to look like support beams. The height of the pillars can be lowered and raised to match the height of the walls.
  • To cover the porch, go to the second floor and build a room over the deck area.
  • Knock down the walls and the ceiling with the hammer, and the floor will remain.
  • Use flooring to make the porch cover match.

Players can decorate wrap-around porches with benches, plants, and other clutter items.

How to Build a Deck with a Pool

Players can also build decks around pools in The Sims 4 . However, things get a little tricky when placing pools. First, players must place the deck. Then, they add the pool using the placement tool or one of the pre-made pool shapes. Finally, players can add pool borders to make them look more cohesive.

Pools can't be built on stilt foundations.

Pool decor and water effects can also be added to make pools look unique. Players can also add pool floats and ladders to give their Sims pool activities.

item.title: 8 Best Turn-Based RPGs Where Speed Matters
item.description:
Summary

  • Speed is crucial in turn-based RPGs like Wasteland 3, impacting movement and action points.
  • In games like Fire Emblem: Awakening, high speed leads to double attacks and better survivability.
  • Speed determines turn order and combat initiative, essential for tactical advantage in games like Octopath Traveler.

Role-playing games come in many different flavors, from action games featuring twitch gameplay, to more relaxing RPGs that let the player consider their actions turn by turn. And then there are a whole host of games that mix and match game mechanics to create something unique.

When it comes to turn-based RPGs, some games include combat mechanics that take speed into consideration in some way. This could be to decide who has the next combat turn, how easily attacks are dodged, and a host of other reasons. In these games, agility and movement can be a key component of a build.

8 Wasteland 3

Tactical Turn-Based RPG

Your comment has not been saved

Wasteland 3
9 /10
9.6 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 86 /100 Critics Rec: 96%
Released
August 28, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Publisher(s)
Deep Silver
Platform(s)
PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Set in a post-apocalyptic version of Colorado, Wasteland 3 puts the player in control of a team of Desert Rangers. The game is renowned for its excellent storytelling, level of customization, and the need to think strategically.

Speed plays a huge part in this game. It impacts the distance that can be moved in a turn, how often a Ranger gets to perform an action, and a host of other combat mechanics. Put simply, high speed results in more action points, and more action points mean more tactical choices available.

7 Fire Emblem: Awakening

Tactical Grid-Based RPG

Your comment has not been saved

Fire Emblem: Awakening
9 /10
9.5 /10
Released
February 4, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Intelligent Systems, Nintendo SPD
Platform(s)
3DS
Powered by

Fire Emblem: Awakening is a turn-based RPG with combat taking place on a grid. The game features permadeath, so the stakes for losing in combat are high. Speed is more than a stat in this game, it drives several core combat mechanics.

High speed is needed to be able to make double attacks, which are highly beneficial. But speed also has an impact on other factors, such as the ability to evade and dodge incoming damage. Put simply, high speed means a better chance of surviving in combat.

6 The Banner Saga

Norse Inspired Storytelling

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

The Banner Saga
8 /10
8 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 81 /100 Critics Rec: 78%
Released
January 14, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Stoic Studio
Platform(s)
Mobile, PC, PS4, Switch, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

The Banner Saga revolves around a story that is heavily influenced by Norse mythology. The art style reflects this inspiration as well. Speed is important, with combat taking place turn by turn on a grid.

Speed has a direct impact on turn order. However, each faction takes its own turn in the correct sequence, it is only within the player's turn where speed comes into play. Higher speed means higher combat initiative, which can be used to manipulate turn order as well. Speed-based builds can be very powerful tactically.

5 Octopath Traveler

Classic RPG Game Mechanics

Your comment has not been saved

Octopath Traveler
8 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 84 /100 Critics Rec: 85%
Released
July 13, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
Xbox One, Switch, PC, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Octopath Traveler takes traditional RPG elements, but adds modern graphics. This JRPG requires the player to think strategically on multiple levels, and this includes understanding how combat initiative can be a deciding factor in an engagement.

Speed has a direct impact on combat initiative, and also contributes towards accruing Boost Points. These points can be saved up, and then used to fire off a heavy devastating attack on opponents. High speed also gives the player a better chance of being in a position to interrupt a boss, and break enemy defenses.

4 Divinity: Original Sin 2

Deep Dynamic Combat

Your comment has not been saved

Divinity: Original Sin 2
8.5 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 93 /100 Critics Rec: 99%
Released
September 14, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Larian Studios
Platform(s)
Switch, PS4, Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Divinity: Original Sin 2 doesn’t have a stat named speed, it has an equivalent stat named wits, which is essentially the same. There are two ways that this wits stat directly impacts the turn-based combat in this game. Firstly, it gives higher combat initiative, meaning an earlier turn in combat, and secondly, it gives a higher crit chance.

This is a game in which combat initiative can have a massive impact, due to the dynamic nature of combat, including disabling enemies and saving allies. Put simply, the more speed, the easier it is to control the battlefield in Divinity: Original Sin 2 .

3 Final Fantasy X

Conditional Turn-Based Battle

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy X/X-2 HD
9.5 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 83 /100 Critics Rec: 87%
Released
March 18, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, PS4, PS Vita, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Final Fantasy X updated the combat system used in previous games in the franchise, with the new CTB (conditional turn-based battle) system. In this new system, speed is an important factor. Primarily, speed influences turn order, and its impact is visible on-screen at all times during combat.

Turn order is important, as an early turn can be used for an ability that could stop an enemy from attacking, for example. Some characters that have very high speed can even get in multiple attacks right at the start of a battle in Final Fantasy X .

2 Persona 5 Royal

1 More And Baton Pass System

Your comment has not been saved

Persona 5 Royal
10 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 94 /100 Critics Rec: 98%
Released
October 31, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
P Studio, Atlus
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X and Series S, Microsoft Windows
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Persona 5 Roya l is a turn-based RPG that really adds some dynamism to the combat mechanics. Two innovative combat features have been added to this game. Firstly, the “1 More” system, which works by giving the player another turn if they hit a weak spot on an enemy. Secondly, the “Baton Pass” system, allows the player to pass the extra turn on to a different team member if they wish.

Speed is used to work out who acts first in combat, which is critical for setting up ambushes and for using tactical abilities during boss fights. In some cases, a well-built, fast team member can decimate enemies right at the start of an encounter in this game.

1 Chrono Trigger

Speed Is Vital In Combat

Your comment has not been saved

Chrono Trigger
17
10 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Released
March 11, 1995

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
SNES, PlayStation (Original), PC, Nintendo DS, Android, iOS
Powered by

Chrono Trigger takes the top place on this list because speed is intricately interwoven into the combat mechanics at almost every level. With its ATB (active time battle) system, speed determines when each character takes their turn.

This is an important consideration in boss battles, with fast characters being able to counter incoming attacks or interrupt bosses more often. The duel and triple techs also rely on speed, enabling characters to queue up combo abilities, which can be absolutely devastating when used correctly in Chrono Trigge r.
